DOC.brief_summary: This study will test the effectiveness of two empirically-supported but distinct treatments for recurrent binge eating in obese patients: 1) Cognitive Behavior Therapy, using a pure self-help approach and 2) sibutramine, an anti-obesity medication also found to have efficacy for binge eating. Self-help Cognitive Behavior Therapy and sibutramine will be administered alone and in combination in a primary care setting.
DOC.brief_title: Treatment of Binge Eating in Obese Patients in Primary Care
DOC.criteria: Obese (BMI >= 30) Medication regimen that represents medical contraindication to sibutramine Serious unstable or uncontrolled medical conditions that represent contraindication to sibutramine Pregnancy
